document.docAuthor: Liu, Yang, Qin, Dao-Zheng, Fletcher, Murray J. & Zhang, Ya-Lin
document.masterDocTitle: Review of Empoasca (Matsumurasca) Anufriev (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Typhlocybinae: Empoascini), with description of three new species from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of Empoasca (Matsumurasca) Anufriev (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Typhlocybinae: Empoascini), with description of three new species from China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality.
Rumtek, Sikkim, India . ( SMTD ). Distribution. India (Sikkim).

paragraph.emphasis:
Key to species of the subgenus
Empoasca ( Matsumurasca Anufriev)
(

paragraph.keyLead: 1 . Aedeagal shaft very short, less than half length of preatrium................................................... 2
- Aedeagal shaft long, nearly as long as, or even longer than, preatrium............................................ 3

2 . Ventral pygofer appendage bent caudodorsad in basal third and adorned with tufted hairs in apical third, apex smooth on ven- tral side (
Fig. 27
)........................................................................
E . ( M .) clypealata

- Ventral pygofer appendage slightly curved dorsad in middle portion and adorned with sparse minute hairs subterminally, apex delicately serrated on ventral side (
Figs 93, 94
)................................................
E . ( M .) parvifacia

4 . Aedeagal shaft with teeth on dorsal side (
Fig. 123
)........................................
E. ( M. ) spinalis
,
sp. nov.
5 . Aedeagal shaft with two pairs of ventral processes........................................................... 6
- Aedeagal shaft with one pair of ventral processes............................................................ 7

6 . Aedeagal shaft with both pairs of ventral processes at base (
Fig. 132
).................................
E . ( M .) thapae

- Aedeagal shaft with one pair of ventral processes at base and second pair subapically (
Fig. 114
)........
E . ( M .) quadrialata
- Aedeagal shaft nearly straight in lateral view, gonopore terminal................................................ 8

8 . Ventral pygofer appendage slightly S-shaped, directed caudad (
Fig. 53
)...............................
E. ( M .) diversa

- Ventral pygofer appendage nearly straight, bent and directed dorsad at its base (
Fig. 2
)......................
E . ( M .) aino

10 . Anal tube process of almost the same width throughout and distinctly toothed at apex (
Fig. 44
)....
E. ( M. ) dentalis
,
sp. nov.

- Anal tube process strongly narrowed apically and not toothed at apex (
Fig. 19
)................
E. ( M. ) biprocessa
,
sp. nov.
11 . Ventral pygofer appendage smooth, not serrated or coarsely sculptured.......................................... 12
- Ventral pygofer appendage serrated terminally or subterminally, or coarsely sculptured subterminally.................. 13
13 . Ventral pygofer appendage serrated terminally or subterminally................................................ 14

- Ventral pygofer appendage coarsely sculptured subterminally, not serrated.............................
E. ( M. ) schima

14 . Ventral pygofer appendage serrated terminally, exceeding caudal margin of pygofer lobe (
Figs 35, 36
)......
E . ( M .) conifera

- Ventral pygofer appendage serrated subterminally at ventral side, not exceeding caudal margin of pygofer lobe (
Figs 72, 73
)........................................................................................
E . ( M .) latissima
